    • Method Detail

      • welcomeNewPlayer

        public void welcomeNewPlayer()
        The welcome() method is called when a player starts a fresh game. It introduces the background story, shows the player the available commands and gives the player some instruction as to how to play the game.

      • welcomeBackPlayer

        public void welcomeBackPlayer()
        Called when a player loads a saved game

      • startUpMenu

        public void startUpMenu()
        Called when a new game is started

      • play

        public void play()
        The play() method sets up the parser and the loop. The finished local variable serves as a flag to the while loop. A Scanner object is used for reading input. A case for each command is defined in the switch expression.

      • getCommand

        public Command getCommand()
        The method processes each line of input. First word is considered the command, and if there are second and third they are the objects of the command.
        Returns:
        The next command from the user.

      • askForPlayersName

        public void askForPlayersName()
        Gets the player name and passes it to the Player class

      • getPlayersName

        public java.lang.String getPlayersName()
        Returns:
        the player's name

      • showCommands

        Print out a list of valid command words.
